japanese: あー……疲れた……。
translation: Ahh... I'm so tired...

japanese: なんとか無事に終わった……。
translation: It somehow ended without any issues...

japanese:
２人ともぐったりだね。
大丈夫？
translation: Both of you look exhausted. Are you okay?

japanese:
体に力が入らないんだよ。
どうも、緊張の糸が切れたらしい。
translation:
I feel so drained.
It's like all the tension
has been released from my body.

japanese: 私も……。
translation: Me too...

japanese:
本当に失敗しなくて良かった。
風太郎が言った通り、夢はただの夢だったね。
translation:
I'm really glad we didn't mess up.
As Futaro said, dreams are just dreams, after all.

japanese:
だろ？
変な夢見たくらいで、心配しすぎなんだよ。
translation:
Right?
You worry too much over a silly dream.

japanese:
変な夢？
失敗する夢を見たの？
translation:
A silly dream?
Did you dream about the wedding failing?

japanese:
うん。
昨日の夜に見ちゃったんだ。
すっごい悪夢。
translation:
Yeah. I had it last night.
It was a terrible nightmare.

japanese:
私がウェディングドレスをひっかけて転んだり、
風太郎が飲み物をこぼしたり、
とにかく失敗の連続で――
translation:
I kept tripping over my wedding dress,
Futaro was spilling drinks,
it was just a series of failures%p-2;――

japanese:
最後は、みんなへの手紙が
風太郎と文通してた時の手紙になってて、
みんなの前で読むことになっちゃって……。
translation:
And in the end, the letter I wrote to everyone turned
into a letter from the time when Futaro and I were pen
pals, and I had to read it in front of everyone...

japanese: ったく、なんでそうなるんだ。
translation: Oh man. Why did it turn out like that?

japanese:
もう、めちゃくちゃ恥ずかしくて……
死んじゃうかと思った……。
translation:
I was so embarrassed...
I thought I was gonna die...

japanese: お兄ちゃんと三玖さん、文通してたの？
translation: Big bro and Miku-san, you guys were pen pals?

japanese:
ああ。
そういや、らいはは知らないか。
俺が上京してからだし。
translation:
Yeah.
Ah, you didn't know that, huh, Raiha.
It started after I moved to Tokyo.

japanese:
そっかぁ、そんな風に愛を育んでたんだ。
へーえ。
translation:
I see. So you were sustaining your relationship in that way.
Wow.

japanese: その言い方は止めろって……。
translation: Stop phrasing it like that...

japanese:
あの手紙、全部大切に取ってあるよ。
風太郎も？
translation:
I have all those letters safely kept.
What about you, Futaro?

japanese: そりゃ、もちろんだが――
translation: Of course, I do too, but%p-2;――

japanese:
おい、それ、あいつらに
見つからないようにしてあったんだよな？
万が一見られてたら、今度は俺が死ぬ……！
translation:
Hey, make sure they don't find 'em.
If by any chance they see them, I'd die from embarassment!

japanese:
ふふ、大丈夫。
宝物だから大事にしまってあるよ。
translation:
Teehee, don't worry.
They're my treasured possessions, and safely stored.

japanese: 頼むぜ……。
translation: I'm counting on you...

japanese:
でも本当に、
そんな悪夢が正夢にならなくてよかった。
translation:
But seriously,
I'm relieved that the nightmare didn't come true.

japanese: 久しぶりに三玖のネガティブ思考が炸裂してたな。
translation:
It's been a while
since I've seen you negative, Miku.

japanese:
だって、一生に一度だから、
絶対にいい思い出にしたくて。
translation:
Well, it's a once-in-a-lifetime event,
so I wanted to make sure it's a good memory for sure.

japanese:
大丈夫、とっても素敵な式だった！
三玖さん、本当に綺麗だったよ。
translation:
Don't worry, it was a beautiful ceremony!
Miku-san, you looked stunning.

japanese: ありがとう、らいはちゃん。
translation: Thank you, Raiha-chan.

japanese:
あ、そうだ。
結婚指輪も、持ってきてくれてありがとう。
translation:
Oh, that reminds me.
Thank you for bringing the wedding rings.

japanese:
あー！　それ！
お兄ちゃん、本当に信じられない！
translation:
Ah! That!
Big bro, I REALLY can't believe you forgot it!

japanese:
う……。
それについてはすまんとしか。
translation:
Ooh...
I can only apologize for that.

japanese: しかも、お父さんも同じことやったみたいだし。
translation:
And to make matters worse,
it seems Dad did the same thing.

japanese:
親父も？
マジかよ。
translation:
Dad, too?
Seriously?

japanese:
三玖さん。
うちの家系はこんな感じだから、
たくさん迷惑かけると思うけど――
translation:
Miku-san.
Our whole family seems to be like this,
so we'll probably be causing you a lot of trouble, but%p-2;――

japanese: お兄ちゃんのこと、よろしくお願いします。
translation: Please take care of big bro.

japanese:
ううん、こちらこそ。
これから家族の一員として、よろしくお願いします。
translation:
No, it's the other way around.
From now on, please take care of me
as a member of the family.

japanese:
えへへ……。
なんか照れちゃうね、こういうの。
translation:
Ehehe...
These things make you blush, don't they?

japanese: ふふ、そうだね。
translation: Teehee, yeah, they do.

japanese:
あ、そうだ。
三玖さんが良かったらなんだけど、
喫茶店のお手伝いをさせてもらってもいい？
translation:
Ah, by the way.
If it's okay with you, Miku-san,
I'd like to help out at the cafe.

japanese:
お店でアルバイトしたいってこと？
もちろんいいよ、二乃も喜ぶと思う。
translation:
You want to work part-time at the cafe?
Of course, that would be great.
Nino would be happy too.

japanese:
なんだ、急にバイトなんて。
欲しい物でもあるのか？
translation:
What's with the sudden part-time job?
Do you want something in particular?

japanese:
そうじゃなくて。
もっと仲良くなりたいと思って。
お姉ちゃんと。
translation:
Not really.
I just want to feel closer to you, big sis.

japanese:
嬉しい。
私も、らいはちゃんともっと仲良くなりたい。
translation:
I'm so happy.
I also want to feel closer to you, Raiha-chan.

japanese: よかった！
translation: Great!

japanese:
じゃあ、お兄ちゃんの
コントロールの仕方もばっちり伝授するね。
translation:
Then, I'll teach you
all about controlling big bro perfectly.

japanese:
待て待て、らいは。
お前、三玖に余計なことを吹き込もうとしてないか？
translation:
Hold on, Raiha.
Are you trying to put needless ideas into Miku's head?

japanese:
余計じゃないよ、すごく重要。
らいはちゃん、よろしく。
translation:
They're not needless, they're really important.
Thanks in advance, Raiha-chan.

japanese: 任せて！
translation: Leave it to me!

japanese:
あ、でも、いざとなったら
文通の手紙って切り札があるから、
教えなくても三玖さんが最強かも？
translation:
Ah, but if it comes down to it, Miku-san,
you might actually be untouchable 
since you hold the trump card a.k.a. the letter?

japanese: おいっ！？
translation: Hey?!

japanese: 切り札は最後まで取っておくものだから。
translation: A trump card should be kept until the end.

japanese:
三玖。
ちょっと話し合おうか？
translation:
Miku.
Shall we have a talk?

japanese: 冗談だよ。
translation: Just kidding.

japanese:
ふふっ！
それじゃ、私、スーツ返してくるね。
translation:
Teehee!
Well then, I'll go return your suit.

japanese:
ああ、わかった。
サンキューな。
translation:
Okay, got it.
Thanks.

japanese:
……三玖。
らいはの言うことは、あまり真に受けないでくれよ？
translation:
...Miku.
Please don't take Raiha's words too seriously.

japanese:
風太郎、らいはちゃんには
いつまでたっても勝てないんだね。
translation:
Futaro, you still can't beat Raiha-chan
no matter how much time passes.

japanese:
でも、らいはちゃんが
うちでバイトしてくれるなんて。
出会った時はまだ小学生だったのに。
translation:
But it's amazing to think she's
going to be working at our place.
When we met she was still in elementary school.

japanese:
もう５年だからな。
……ようやく一区切りか。
translation:
It's been five years already.
...Our first milestone, I guess.

japanese: 区切りで、スタートでもあるよ。
translation: A milestone that's also a new beginning.

japanese:
夫婦として、家族として……
これから風太郎とやっていきたいことがたくさんある。
translation:
As husband and wife, as a family...
There are so many things I want to do with you, Futaro.

japanese: やっていきたいこと、か。
translation: Things you want to do, huh?

japanese: ……風太郎？
translation: ...Futaro?

japanese:
お前、言ったよな。
誓いのキスの時、５年前を思い出せって。
translation:
You said it, didn't you?
During our vow kiss,
to remember back five years ago.

japanese:
……うん。
学園祭で初めてキスしたの、覚えてた？
translation:
...Yeah.
Do you remember our first kiss at the school festival?

japanese: もちろんだ。
translation: Of course.

japanese:
とはいえ、あのキスを思い出せって言われてもなぁ。
押し倒されて、お前にされるがままだったんだぞ？
translation:
Although, even if you tell me to remember that kiss,
well... I was overwhelmed,
and just went along with whatever you did.

japanese: ふふっ、そうだったかも。
translation: Teehee, maybe that's how it was.

japanese:
やりたいこととか
気持ちをため込んだお前は怖いからな。
これからも我慢しないで、どんどん言ってくれ。
translation:
Because you become all scary
when you bottle up your emotions inside.
From now on, don't hold back, and tell me everything.

japanese: ……いいの？
translation: ...Is that okay?

japanese: え？
translation: Huh?

japanese: じゃあ、さっそくだけど――
translation: Well then, that being said%p-2;――

japanese:
ちょっ！？
な、なんだよ！？
translation:
What the?!
Wh-what are you doing?

japanese: したいこと、考えておくね。
translation: I'll start thinking about what I want to do.

japanese: ……お、おう。
translation: ...O-okay.

japanese:
（なんだろうか……。
　らいはだけじゃなく
　三玖にも勝てない気がしてきたような……）
translation:
(What is this feeling...
 It's like I can't win against not only Raiha,
 but Miku, either...)

japanese:
風太郎も。
私に遠慮なんてしないで、なんでも言って。
translation:
Futaro, you too.
Don't hesitate to tell or ask me anything,

japanese: じゃあ、１ついいか？
translation: Alright, can I ask you one thing?

japanese: なに？
translation: What is it?

japanese: それは――
translation: Well%p-2;――
